rev.comment: undo fair use abuse via WP:NFCC
rev.diff:
Line 9: Line 9:
{{main|Ada Wong}}
{{main|Ada Wong}}
==Sherry Birkin==
==Sherry Birkin==
â
[[Image:Sherry_Birkin.jpg|thumb|left|75px]]
 
'''Sherry Birkin''' (voiced by Lisa Yamanaka) is a 12 year old girl who serves as Claire's partner in the game. She is the daughter of [[G-Virus]] creator [[#William Birkin|William Birkin]] and was instructed by her [[#Annette Birkin|mother]] to seek refuge in the [[Raccoon Police Department|police station]] during the zombie outbreak. She spends time on the run from the zombies until she meets Claire. The dangers Sherry faces change depending on the order in which Claire's half of the game is played. In the "Claire A" scenario, she is implanted with a G-Virus embryo by G, the creature that was once her father, and Claire must prepare a G-Virus vaccine before Sherry undergoes mutation. In the "Claire B" scenario, Sherry is chased by the [[Tyrant (Resident Evil)|Tyrant]] sent by Umbrella to retrieve the G-Virus hidden inside her locket.
'''Sherry Birkin''' (voiced by Lisa Yamanaka) is a 12 year old girl who serves as Claire's partner in the game. She is the daughter of [[G-Virus]] creator [[#William Birkin|William Birkin]] and was instructed by her [[#Annette Birkin|mother]] to seek refuge in the [[Raccoon Police Department|police station]] during the zombie outbreak. She spends time on the run from the zombies until she meets Claire. The dangers Sherry faces change depending on the order in which Claire's half of the game is played. In the "Claire A" scenario, she is implanted with a G-Virus embryo by G, the creature that was once her father, and Claire must prepare a G-Virus vaccine before Sherry undergoes mutation. In the "Claire B" scenario, Sherry is chased by the [[Tyrant (Resident Evil)|Tyrant]] sent by Umbrella to retrieve the G-Virus hidden inside her locket.
Line 21: Line 20:
==Ben Bertolucci==
==Ben Bertolucci==
â
<!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Ben Bertolucci (RE2).jpg|thumb|right|100px|Ben Bertolucci]] -->
 
'''Ben Bertolucci''' (voiced by Rod Wilson) is a freelance journalist who has a prominent role in Leon's half of the game. Leon and Ada first meet Ben after he has locked himself in one of the precinct's holding cells and refuses to divulge any information. Later, the G-Type finds a way into his cell and he is fatally injured or infected with the G-Virus. While dying, he provides Leon with a copy of Birkin's e-mails to Chief Irons, which details the dealings between the two.
'''Ben Bertolucci''' (voiced by Rod Wilson) is a freelance journalist who has a prominent role in Leon's half of the game. Leon and Ada first meet Ben after he has locked himself in one of the precinct's holding cells and refuses to divulge any information. Later, the G-Type finds a way into his cell and he is fatally injured or infected with the G-Virus. While dying, he provides Leon with a copy of Birkin's e-mails to Chief Irons, which details the dealings between the two.
Line 28: Line 26:
==Brian Irons==
==Brian Irons==
â
<!-- Unsourced image removed: [[Image:Brian Irons (RE2).jpg|100px|right|thumb|Chief Irons]] -->
 
'''Brian Irons''' (voiced by Gary Krawford) is the city's corrupt [[Raccoon Police Department|Chief of Police]] and appears only in Claire's half of the game. Claire first meets the Chief in his office with the recently deceased body of the Mayor's daughter on his desk. He later disappears from the office and leaves behind his diary, in which he describes his desire to hunt down the Mayor's daughter and use her body as a [[taxidermy|stuffed trophy]].
'''Brian Irons''' (voiced by Gary Krawford) is the city's corrupt [[Raccoon Police Department|Chief of Police]] and appears only in Claire's half of the game. Claire first meets the Chief in his office with the recently deceased body of the Mayor's daughter on his desk. He later disappears from the office and leaves behind his diary, in which he describes his desire to hunt down the Mayor's daughter and use her body as a [[taxidermy|stuffed trophy]].
Line 40: Line 37:
==Marvin Branagh==
==Marvin Branagh==
â
[[Image:Marvin_Branagh.jpg|thumb|left|100px|Marvin Branagh (early conceptual artwork)]]
 
'''Marvin Branagh''' is a surviving [[Raccoon Police Department|R.P.D.]] officer whom the player meets after their arrival at the precinct. The character is not named until [[Resident Evil 3]], in which he briefly appears also. Marvin, already suffering from a fatal wound and succumbing to the [[T-Virus]], urges the player to locate any survivors and provides them with a card key before locking himself inside the west office. When the player later regains access to the office, Marvin has disappeared, however his wounds would suggest that he had turned into a zombie.
'''Marvin Branagh''' is a surviving [[Raccoon Police Department|R.P.D.]] officer whom the player meets after their arrival at the precinct. The character is not named until [[Resident Evil 3]], in which he briefly appears also. Marvin, already suffering from a fatal wound and succumbing to the [[T-Virus]], urges the player to locate any survivors and provides them with a card key before locking himself inside the west office. When the player later regains access to the office, Marvin has disappeared, however his wounds would suggest that he had turned into a zombie.
Line 53: Line 49:
==HUNK==
==HUNK==
â
[[Image:Hunkuc.PNG|200px|thumb|left|HUNK in ''[[Resident Evil: The Umbrella Chronicles]]'']]
 
'''[[HUNK]]''' debuted as the player's character in the unlockable [[minigame]] "The 4th Survivor" in ''Resident Evil 2''. He is a member of the Umbrella Special Forces team which is attacked and wiped out by the mutated William Birkin. HUNK is the only member of the team to survive Birkin's attack, and successfully procure a sample of the G-Virus. The player's objective as HUNK is to escape the sewer, and reach the heliport atop the police precinct. Another minigame, titled "The Tofu Survivor," is essentially identical, replacing HUNK with a giant piece of [[tofu]], is a parody, and a harder version of HUNK's minigame.
'''[[HUNK]]''' debuted as the player's character in the unlockable [[minigame]] "The 4th Survivor" in ''Resident Evil 2''. He is a member of the Umbrella Special Forces team which is attacked and wiped out by the mutated William Birkin. HUNK is the only member of the team to survive Birkin's attack, and successfully procure a sample of the G-Virus. The player's objective as HUNK is to escape the sewer, and reach the heliport atop the police precinct. Another minigame, titled "The Tofu Survivor," is essentially identical, replacing HUNK with a giant piece of [[tofu]], is a parody, and a harder version of HUNK's minigame.
